# Default Theme

The NextUI theme object is where you define your application's color palette, fonts, font sizes, breakpoints, border radius values, and more.

<CarbonAd />

## Theme type

NextUI comes with two types of themes:

```ts
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: 'light' | 'dark', // light is set by default
  ...
};
```

<Spacer y={2} />

## Palette

NextUI includes a default color palette out-of-the-box that is a great starting point if you donâ€™t have your own specific branding in mind.

        "primary",
        "secondary",
        "success",
        "warning",
        "error",
        "gradient"
    ]}/>
 `}
/>

 `}
/>

    ]}/>
 `}
/>

<Playground
  title="Highlight"
  showEditor={false}
  code={`
    <Palette inverted colors={[
        "link",
        "selection",
        "code"
    ]}/>
 `}
/>

## Typography

To manage Typography options you can use the following keys:

1. fonts (font families)
2. fontSizes
3. fontWeights
4. lineHeights

#### 1. Fonts

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  colors: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {
    sans: "-apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', 'Roboto', 'Oxygen', 'Ubuntu', 'Cantarell',
    'Fira Sans', 'Droid Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;",
    mono: "Menlo, Monaco, 'Lucida Console', 'Liberation Mono',
    'DejaVu Sans Mono', 'Bitstream Vera Sans Mono'"
  }
  ...
};
```

#### 2. Font sizes

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  colors: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {
        xs: "0.875rem",
        base:"1rem",
        sm: "1.25rem",
        md: "1.5rem",
        lg: "2.25rem",
        xl: "3rem",
    }
  ...
};
```

#### 3. Font weights

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  colors: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {...}, // font sizes object
  fontWeights: {
    thin: 200,
    light: 300,
    normal: 400,
    medium: 500,
    semibold: 600,
    bold: 700,
    extrabold: 800,
    black: 900
  }
  ...
};
```

#### 4. Line heights

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  colors: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {...}, // font sizes object
  fontWeights: {...}, // font weights object
  lineHeights: {
    xs: 1,
    sm: 1.25,
    md: 1.5,
    lg: 1.625,
    xl: 1.75
  }
  ...
};
```

<Spacer y={2} />

## Radius

NextUI provides a set of commons sizes for controlling the `border-radius` of an element.

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  colors: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {...}, // font sizes object
  fontWeights: {...}, // font weights object
  lineHeights: {...}, // line heights object
  radius: {
    xs: "2px",
    sm: "6px",
    md: "10px",
    lg: "14px", // default for almost every NextUI component
    xl: "28px"
  }
  ...
};
```

<Spacer y={2} />

## Spacing

NextUI has a set of most common spaces values which allows you to customize the
global spacing and sizing scale for your project. By default these spacing value
can be referenced by the `padding`, `margin`, and `top`, `left`, `right`, `bottom` styles.

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  // ... previous theme properties
  spacing: {
    0: "0rem",
    xs: "0.5rem",
    sm: "0.75rem",
    md: "1rem",
    lg: "1.25rem",
    xl: "2.25rem",
    px: "1px",
    0.5: "0.125rem",
    1: "0.25rem",
    1.5: "0.375rem",
    2: "0.5rem",
    2.5: "0.625rem",
    3: "0.75rem",
    3.5: "0.875rem",
    4: "1rem",
    5: "1.25rem",
    6: "1.5rem",
    7: "1.75rem",
    8: "2rem",
    9: "2.25rem",
    10: "2.5rem",
    11: "2.75rem",
    12: "3rem",
    14: "3.5rem",
    16: "4rem",
    20: "5rem",
    24: "6rem",
    28: "7rem",
    32: "8rem",
    36: "9rem",
    40: "10rem",
    44: "11rem",
    48: "12rem",
    52: "13rem",
    56: "14rem",
    60: "15rem",
    64: "16rem",
    72: "18rem",
    80: "20rem",
    96: "24rem"
  }
  ...
};
```

NetxUI's spacing scale has been inspired by [Tailwind CSS](https://tailwindcss.com/).
The values are proportional, so 1 spacing unit is equal to 0.25rem, which translates to 4px by default in common browsers.

> **TIP**: If you need a spacing of 40px, divide it by 4. That'll give you 10. Then use it in your component.

<Spacer y={2} />

| 0    | 0px      | 0px    | <Progress squared value={0} max={100} />                                   |

| 44   | 11rem    | 176px  | <Progress squared value={176} max={384} />                                 |
| 48   | 12rem    | 192px  | <Progress squared value={192} max={384} />                                 |
| 56   | 14rem    | 224px  | <Progress squared value={224} max={384} />                                 |
| 60   | 15rem    | 240px  | <Progress squared value={240} max={384} />                                 |

<Spacer y={2} />

## Breakpoints

NextUI exposes to you a predefined set of commonly used breakpoints which are used on components
like [Container](/docs/layout/container) and [Grid](/docs/layout/grid).

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  // ... previous theme properties
  breakpoints: {
    xs: '576px',
    sm: '768px',
    md: '992px',
    lg: '1200px',
    xl: '1400px'
  }
  ...
};
```

<Spacer y={2} />

## Shadows

NextUI provides a curated set of predefined shadows for `light` and `dark` themes.

```js
// light theme
export const lightTheme = {
  // default theme object
  // ... previous theme properties
  shadows: {
      xs: '0 2px 10px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
      sm: '0 5px 20px -5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
      md: '0 8px 30px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.15)',
      lg: '0 30px 60px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.15)',
      xl: '0 40px 80px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25)'
  }
  ...
};
// dark theme
export const lightTheme = {
  // default theme object
  // ... previous theme properties
  shadows: {
    xs: '0 2px 10px -3px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.1)',
    sm: '0 5px 20px -5px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.1)',
    md: '0 8px 30px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.15)',
    lg: '0 30px 60px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.15)',
    xl: '0 40px 80px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.25)'
  }
  ...
};
```
